message:
no more dependencies hell ? 

"Snap packages can (though donâ€™t have to) contain both application binary and any dependencies required for it to run. Yup, even if those libraries are already installed on the host system.
...
Applications packaged in the format are isolated from the rest of the system. You can install a snappy package without worrying about what it might do to other software you have installed."
story: Ahmed Mohamed Kamal shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: With Snaps, Ubuntu 16.04 Makes App Updates Easier, Secure
caption: omgubuntu.co.uk
description: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS will come with support for Canonical's (relatively new) Snap packaging format.

data.message: cool, so now ubuntu can work like windows dependency wise. but we can no longer brag that Ubuntu takes just 5GB of disk space
